share</font></div></td></tr></table><div style="line-height:120%;padding-

size:12pt;"><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-
size:12pt;"><br></font></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-
align:justify;font-size:12pt;"><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-
size:12pt;color:#002574;font-weight:bold;">SAN ANTONIO - </font><font 
style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-size:12pt;color:#002574;font-
weight:bold;">August&#160;3, 2016</font><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-
serif;font-size:12pt;color:#828282;">&#32;</font><font style="font-
family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-size:12pt;">- Tesoro Corporation (NYSE:TSO) today
reported </font><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-
size:12pt;">second</font><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-
size:12pt;">&#32;quarter net earnings from continuing operations of </font><font
style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-size:12pt;">$418 million</font><font 
style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-size:12pt;">, or </font><font 
style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-size:12pt;">$3.47</font><font 
style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-size:12pt;">&#32;per diluted share 
compared to net earnings from continuing operations of </font><font style="font-
family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-size:12pt;">$586 million</font><font style="font-
family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-size:12pt;">, or </font><font style="font-
family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-size:12pt;">$4.62</font><font style="font-
family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-size:12pt;">&#32;per diluted share a year ago. 
Consolidated net earnings were </font><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-
serif;font-size:12pt;">$449 million</font><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-
serif;font-size:12pt;">&#32;for the </font><font style="font-
family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-size:12pt;">second</font><font style="font-
family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-size:12pt;">&#32;quarter </font><font 
style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-size:12pt;">2016</font><font 
style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-size:12pt;">&#32;compared to 
</font><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-size:12pt;">$620 
million</font><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-
size:12pt;">&#32;for the same period last year. EBITDA for the </font><font 
style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-size:12pt;">second</font><font 
style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-size:12pt;">&#32;quarter of 
</font><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-
size:12pt;">2016</font><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-
size:12pt;">&#32;was </font><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-
size:12pt;">$956 million</font><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-
size:12pt;">&#32;compared to </font><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-
serif;font-size:12pt;">$1.2 billion</font><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-
serif;font-size:12pt;">&#32;last year. </font><font style="font-
family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-size:12pt;">Second</font><font style="font-
family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-size:12pt;">&#32;quarter </font><font 
style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-size:12pt;">2016</font><font

size:10pt;"><br></font></div></td></tr></table></div></div><div style="line-

family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-size:9pt;"><br></font></div><div style="line-
height:120%;text-align:justify;font-size:12pt;"><font style="font-
family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-size:12pt;">&#8220;Tesoro&#8217;s integrated 
business model continues to perform well, even with the Tesoro Index 
</font><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-
size:12pt;">6%</font><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-
size:12pt;">&#32;lower this quarter compared to the average of 2014 and 
2015,&#8221; said Greg Goff, Chairman and CEO. &#8220;We continue to focus on 
driving sustainable improvements to the business and growing Logistics and 
Marketing to further enhance shareholder value.&#8221;</font></div><div 
style="line-height:120%;text-align:justify;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-
family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;"><br></font></div><div><br></div><div 
style="text-align:center;"><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:right;font-
size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">Tesoro 
Corporation 2016 </font><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-
size:10pt;font-weight:bold;">|</font><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-
serif;font-size:10pt;">&#32;</font><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-
serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:bold;">1</font></div></div><hr style="page-
break-after:always"><div></div><div><br></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-
align:justify;font-size:12pt;"><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-
size:12pt;">For the </font><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-
size:12pt;">second</font><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-
size:12pt;">&#32;quarter, the Company recorded segment operating income of 
</font><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-size:12pt;">$806 
million</font><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-
size:12pt;">&#32;compared to segment operating income of </font><font 
style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-size:12pt;">$1.1 billion</font><font 
style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-size:12pt;">&#32;in the </font><font 
style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-size:12pt;">second</font><font 
style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-size:12pt;">&#32;quarter of 
</font><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-
size:12pt;">2015</font><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-
size:12pt;">. </font><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-
size:12pt;">Second</font><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-
size:12pt;">&#32;quarter </font><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-
serif;font-size:12pt;">2016</font><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-
serif;font-size:12pt;">&#32;results reflect lower operating income in Refining 
and Marketing, offset by continued growth in Logistics.</font></div><div 
style="line-height:120%;text-align:justify;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-
family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;"><br></font></div><div style="line-
height:120%;text-align:justify;font-size:12pt;"><font style="font-
family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-size:12pt;">Tesoro previously provided adjusted 
EBITDA, adjusted earnings and certain other metrics including special 
adjustments for unusual items impacting quarterly results.&#160;The Company 
decided to limit its disclosures of non-GAAP financial measures to EBITDA (which
has been revised to include discontinued operations), segment EBITDA and debt to
capitalization, excluding Tesoro Logistics LP (NTSE:TLLP). The Company also 
adjusted the presentation of certain items to conform to recent guidance 
regarding non-GAAP measures. Tesoro will continue to highlight significant items
impacting quarterly results in its earnings releases and quarterly SEC filings 
to facilitate analysis of its results.&#160; </font></div><div style="line-
height:120%;text-align:justify;font-size:12pt;"><font style="font-
family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-size:12pt;"><br></font></div><div style="line-
height:120%;text-align:justify;font-size:12pt;"><font style="font-
family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-size:12pt;color:#828282;font-
weight:bold;">SEGMENT RESULTS</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-
align:justify;font-size:12pt;"><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-
size:12pt;color:#002574;font-weight:bold;">REFINING.</font><font style="font-
family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-size:12pt;">&#32;Refining operating income was 
</font><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-size:12pt;">$520 
million</font><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-
size:12pt;">&#32;for the </font><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-
serif;font-size:12pt;">second</font><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-
serif;font-size:12pt;">&#32;quarter </font><font style="font-
family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-size:12pt;">2016</font><font style="font-
family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-size:12pt;">&#32;compared to </font><font 
style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-size:12pt;">$757 million</font><font 
style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-size:12pt;">&#32;in </font><font 
style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-size:12pt;">2015</font><font 
style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-size:12pt;">&#32;and segment EBITDA 
was </font><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-size:12pt;">$692
 million</font><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-
size:12pt;">&#32;compared to </font><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-
serif;font-size:12pt;">$880 million</font><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-
serif;font-size:12pt;">&#32;in 2015. The Tesoro Index</font><font style="font-
family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-size:12pt;"><sup style="vertical-align:top;line-
height:120%;font-size:pt">(b) </sup></font><font style="font-
family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-size:12pt;">was </font><font style="font-
family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-size:12pt;">$13.93</font><font style="font-
family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-size:12pt;">&#32;per barrel for the </font><font 
style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-size:12pt;">second</font><font 
style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-size:12pt;">&#32;quarter with a gross
refining margin of </font><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-
size:12pt;">$15.70</font><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-
size:12pt;">&#32;per barrel or </font><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-
serif;font-size:12pt;">113%</font><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-
serif;font-size:12pt;">&#32;capture of the Tesoro Index, compared to a gross 
refining margin of </font><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-
size:12pt;">$19.13</font><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-
size:12pt;">&#32;per barrel or </font><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-
serif;font-size:12pt;">89%</font><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-
serif;font-size:12pt;">&#32;capture of the Tesoro Index of </font><font 
style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-size:12pt;">$21.61</font><font 
style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-size:12pt;">&#32;per barrel last 
year. </font><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-
size:12pt;">Second</font><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-
size:12pt;">&#32;quarter </font><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-
serif;font-size:12pt;">2016</font><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-
serif;font-size:12pt;">&#32;gross refining margin and segment EBITDA include a 
pre-tax benefit of </font><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-
size:12pt;">$363 million</font><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-
size:12pt;">&#32;related to a LCM inventory adjustment. Total refinery 
throughput for the quarter was </font><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-
serif;font-size:12pt;">802 thousand</font><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-
serif;font-size:12pt;">&#32;barrels per day, or </font><font style="font-
family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-size:12pt;">92%</font><font style="font-
family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-size:12pt;">&#32;utilization. Manufacturing costs
in the </font><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-
size:12pt;">second</font><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-
size:12pt;">&#32;quarter of </font><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-
serif;font-size:12pt;">2016</font><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-
serif;font-size:12pt;">&#32;</font><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-
serif;font-size:12pt;">decreased</font><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-
serif;font-size:12pt;">&#32;</font><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-
serif;font-size:12pt;">$0.57</font><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-
serif;font-size:12pt;">&#32;per barrel over last year to </font><font 
style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-size:12pt;">$5.01</font><font 
style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-size:12pt;">&#32;per barrel, due to a
combination of higher throughput in </font><font style="font-
family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-size:12pt;">2016</font><font style="font-
family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-size:12pt;">&#32;and a decline in natural gas 
prices. Throughput and capture rates in the second quarter were impacted by an 
extension of planned maintenance in the Kenai, Alaska refinery and unplanned 
unit downtime within our California region.</font></div><div style="line-
height:120%;text-align:justify;font-size:12pt;"><font style="font-
family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-size:12pt;"><br></font></div><div style="line-
height:120%;text-align:justify;font-size:12pt;"><font style="font-
family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-size:12pt;color:#002574;font-
weight:bold;">LOGISTICS.</font><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-
size:12pt;font-weight:bold;">&#32;</font><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-
serif;font-size:12pt;">Logistics operating income increased to </font><font 
style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-size:12pt;">$125 million</font><font 
style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-size:12pt;">&#32;in the </font><font 
style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-size:12pt;">second</font><font 
style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-size:12pt;">&#32;quarter 2016 from 
</font><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-size:12pt;">$104 
million</font><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-
size:12pt;">&#32;in </font><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-
size:12pt;">2015</font><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-
size:12pt;">&#32;and segment EBITDA increased to </font><font style="font-
family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-size:12pt;">$172 million</font><font style="font-
family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-size:12pt;">&#32;from </font><font style="font-
family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-size:12pt;">$149 million</font><font style="font-
family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-size:12pt;">&#32;last year. This performance was 
driven by volume growth in TLLP&#8217;s crude oil gathering and natural gas 
gathering and processing businesses as well as contributions from the LA Storage
and Handling Assets acquisition. Year-to-date, TLLP has seen volume growth of 
approximately </font><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-
size:12pt;">23%</font><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-
size:12pt;">&#32;in crude oil pipeline gathering volumes, </font><font 
style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-size:12pt;">5%</font><font 
style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-size:12pt;">&#32;in NGL processing 
throughput, </font><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-
size:12pt;">4%</font><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-
size:12pt;">&#32;in terminalling throughput and </font><font style="font-
family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-size:12pt;">4%</font><font style="font-
family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-size:12pt;">&#32;in pipeline transportation 
volumes over the same period last year.</font></div><div style="line-
height:120%;text-align:justify;font-size:12pt;"><font style="font-
family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-size:12pt;"><br></font></div><div style="line-
height:120%;text-align:justify;font-size:12pt;"><font style="font-
family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-size:12pt;color:#002574;font-
weight:bold;">MARKETING.</font><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-
size:12pt;font-weight:bold;">&#32;</font><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-
serif;font-size:12pt;">Marketing operating income was </font><font style="font-
family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-size:12pt;">$161 million</font><font style="font-
family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-size:12pt;">&#32;compared to </font><font 
style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-size:12pt;">$212 million</font><font 
style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-size:12pt;">&#32;a year ago and 
segment EBITDA was </font><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-
size:12pt;">$173 million</font><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-
size:12pt;">&#32;compared to </font><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-
serif;font-size:12pt;">$223 million</font><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-
serif;font-size:12pt;">&#32;a year ago. In the quarter, the Company experienced 
lower overall margins but continued to see high consumer demand and growth in 
the branded network of retail stations. Total stations in </font><font 
style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-size:12pt;">second</font><font 
style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-size:12pt;">&#32;quarter grew 
</font><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-
size:12pt;">8%</font><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-
size:12pt;">&#32;over the same period last year. The year-over-year decline in 
operating income was impacted by fuel margins which declined to </font><font 
style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-size:12pt;">10.5</font><font 
style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-size:12pt;">&#32;cents per gallon 
from </font><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-
size:12pt;">13.7</font><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-
size:12pt;">&#32;cents per gallon a year ago.</font></div><div style="line-
height:120%;text-align:justify;font-size:12pt;"><font style="font-
family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-size:12pt;"><br></font></div><div style="line-
height:120%;text-align:justify;font-size:12pt;"><font style="font-
family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-size:12pt;color:#828282;font-
weight:bold;">CORPORATE AND OTHER</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-
align:justify;font-size:12pt;"><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-
size:12pt;">Corporate and unallocated costs for the </font><font style="font-
family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-size:12pt;">second</font><font style="font-
family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-size:12pt;">&#32;quarter </font><font 
style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-size:12pt;">2016</font><font 
style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-size:12pt;">&#32;were </font><font 
style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-size:12pt;">$88 million</font><font 
style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-size:12pt;">. The effective tax rate 
was </font><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-
size:12pt;">34.5%</font><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-
size:12pt;">&#32;for the quarter.</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-
align:justify;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-
size:10pt;"><br></font></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-
align:justify;font-size:12pt;"><font
 style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-size:12pt;color:#828282;font-
weight:bold;">BALANCE SHEET AND CASH FLOW</font></div><div style="line-
height:120%;text-align:justify;font-size:12pt;"><font style="font-
family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-size:12pt;">Tesoro ended the </font><font 
style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-size:12pt;">second</font><font 
style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-size:12pt;">&#32;quarter with
</font><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-size:12pt;">$1.1 
billion</font><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-
size:12pt;">&#32;in cash and cash equivalents compared to </font><font 
style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-size:12pt;">$942 million</font><font 
style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-size:12pt;">&#32;at the end of 
</font><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-
size:12pt;">2015</font><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-
size:12pt;">. Tesoro has </font><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-
serif;font-size:12pt;">$2.1 billion</font><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-
serif;font-size:12pt;">&#32;of availability under the Company&#8217;s revolving 
credit facility. Total debt, net of unamortized issuance costs, was </font><font
style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-size:12pt;">$4.5 billion</font><font 
style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-size:12pt;">&#32;or </font><font 
style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-size:12pt;">36%</font><font 
style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-size:12pt;">&#32;of total 
capitalization at the end of the </font><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-
serif;font-size:12pt;">second</font><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-
serif;font-size:12pt;">&#32;quarter. Excluding TLLP debt and equity, total debt 
was </font><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-size:12pt;">$1.3 
billion</font><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-
size:12pt;">&#32;or </font><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-
size:12pt;">19%</font><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-
size:12pt;">&#32;of total capitalization.</font></div><div style="line-
height:120%;text-align:justify;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-
family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;"><br></font></div><div><br></div><div 
style="text-align:center;"><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:right;font-
size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">Tesoro 
Corporation 2016 </font><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-
size:10pt;font-weight:bold;">|</font><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-
serif;font-size:10pt;">&#32;</font><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-
serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:bold;">2</font></div></div><hr style="page-
break-after:always"><div></div><div><br></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-
align:justify;font-size:12pt;"><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-
size:12pt;">Capital spending for the </font><font style="font-
family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-size:12pt;">second</font><font style="font-
family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-size:12pt;">&#32;quarter was </font><font 
style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-size:12pt;">$167 million</font><font 
style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-size:12pt;">&#32;for Tesoro and 
</font><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-size:12pt;">$42 
million</font><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-
size:12pt;">&#32;for TLLP. Turnaround expenditures for the </font><font 
style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-size:12pt;">second</font><font 
style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-size:12pt;">&#32;quarter were 
</font><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-size:12pt;">$191 
million</font><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-
size:12pt;">.</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:justify;font-
size:12pt;"><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-
size:12pt;"><br></font></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-
align:justify;font-size:12pt;"><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-
size:12pt;">The Company repurchased </font><font style="font-
family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-size:12pt;">1.3 million</font><font style="font-
family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-size:12pt;">&#32;shares for approximately 
</font><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-size:12pt;">$100 
million</font><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-
size:12pt;">&#32;in the second quarter and has </font><font style="font-
family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-size:12pt;">$1.3 billion</font><font style="font-
family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-size:12pt;">&#32;remaining under its previously 
approved share repurchase programs. Tesoro is well positioned to continue to 
execute its financial priorities of investing in high-return capital projects, 
returning cash to shareholders and maintaining a strong balance 
sheet.</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:justify;font-
size:12pt;"><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-
size:12pt;"><br></font></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-
align:justify;font-size:12pt;"><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-
size:12pt;">Tesoro today announced that the board of directors has increased the
quarterly cash dividend by </font><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-
serif;font-size:12pt;">10%</font><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-
serif;font-size:12pt;">&#32;to </font><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-
serif;font-size:12pt;">$0.55</font><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-
serif;font-size:12pt;">&#32;per share payable on </font><font style="font-
family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-size:12pt;">September&#160;15, 2016</font><font 
style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-size:12pt;">, to all holders of 
record as of </font><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-
size:12pt;">August&#160;31, 2016</font><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-
serif;font-size:12pt;">.</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-
align:justify;font-size:12pt;"><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-
size:12pt;"><br></font></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-
align:justify;font-size:12pt;"><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-
size:12pt;color:#828282;font-weight:bold;">STRATEGIC UPDATE</font></div><div 
style="line-height:120%;text-align:justify;font-size:12pt;"><font style="font-
family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-size:12pt;">In June, Tesoro closed the 
acquisition of Flint Hills Resources wholesale marketing and logistics assets in
Anchorage and Fairbanks, Alaska. This acquisition enhances the Company&#8217;s 
capabilities to efficiently and reliably serve customers in the state of Alaska.
In addition, the Company acquired Dakota Prairie Refining, LLC, which owns 
a&#160;refinery near Dickinson, North Dakota, with strategic access to Bakken 
crude oil and is located just 100 miles west of the Tesoro Mandan Refinery. 
Tesoro plans to continue to market the ultra-low sulfur diesel to local 
customers and utilize the naphtha and resid in its integrated value chain 
system.</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:justify;font-
size:12pt;"><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-
size:12pt;"><br></font></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-
align:justify;font-size:12pt;"><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-
size:12pt;">On </font><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-
size:12pt;">July&#160;1, 2016</font><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-
serif;font-size:12pt;">, Tesoro executed an agreement for the sale of storage 
and terminalling assets in Alaska to TLLP for a total consideration of 
</font><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-size:12pt;">$444 
million</font><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-size:12pt;">. The
Alaska Storage and Terminalling Assets include crude oil, feedstock and refined 
product storage tanks in Kenai, Alaska and refined product terminals in 
Anchorage and Fairbanks. The first phase, the storage portion of the 
acquisition, closed on </font><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-
size:12pt;">July&#160;1, 2016</font><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-
serif;font-size:12pt;">. The second phase, the acquisition of the Anchorage and 
Fairbanks terminals, is expected to close in the third quarter once the Consent 
Decree with the State of Alaska becomes effective. The Consent Decree is related
to Tesoro's acquisition of certain Flint Hills Resources Alaska assets, which 
closed on June 20, 2016. The total acquisition price of </font><font 
style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-size:12pt;">$444 million</font><font 
style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-size:12pt;">&#32;includes cash 
proceeds to Tesoro of </font><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-
size:12pt;">$400 million</font><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-
size:12pt;">&#32;and the issuance of common and general partner units to Tesoro,
valued at approximately </font><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-
size:12pt;">$44 million</font><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-
size:12pt;">.</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:justify;font-
size:12pt;"><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-
size:12pt;"><br></font></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-
align:justify;font-size:12pt;"><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-
size:12pt;">At Tesoro's 2015 Investor and Analyst Day, the Company provided its 
expectations for 2016. These included a Tesoro index of </font><font 
style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-size:12pt;">$12 to $14</font><font 
style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-size:12pt;">&#32;per barrel, 
Marketing segment fuel margins of </font><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-
serif;font-size:12pt;">$0.11 to $0.14</font><font style="font-
family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-size:12pt;">&#32;per gallon, crude oil 
differentials reflecting transportation costs and year-over-year improvements
from higher utilization
 and operational efficiencies of $500 to $600 million. Through the first half of
2016, the Tesoro Index and Marketing fuel margins are in line with expectations.
Crude oil differentials continue to be significantly narrower than expectations 
and have resulted in lower capture rates and lower refining profitability than 
the Company&#8217;s expectations. Refining utilization is at the low end of the 
Company&#8217;s expectations, primarily due to unplanned maintenance and, as a 
result, Tesoro now expects year-over-year improvements from higher utilization 
and operational efficiencies of $400 to $500 million.</font></div><div 
style="line-height:120%;text-align:justify;font-size:12pt;"><font style="font-
family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-size:12pt;"><br></font></div><div style="line-
height:120%;text-align:justify;font-size:12pt;"><font style="font-
family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-size:12pt;">In addition, the Company committed to
delivering </font><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-
size:12pt;">$400</font><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-
size:12pt;">&#32;to </font><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-
size:12pt;">$500 million</font><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-
size:12pt;">&#32;of annual improvements to operating income in 2016, consisting 
of </font><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-
size:12pt;">$200</font><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-
size:12pt;">&#32;to </font><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-
size:12pt;">$250 million</font><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-
size:12pt;">&#32;in Refining, </font><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-
serif;font-size:12pt;">$175</font><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-
serif;font-size:12pt;">&#32;to </font><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-
serif;font-size:12pt;">$200 million</font><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-
serif;font-size:12pt;">&#32;in Logistics and </font><font style="font-
family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-size:12pt;">$25</font><font style="font-
family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-size:12pt;">&#32;to </font><font style="font-
family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-size:12pt;">$50 million</font><font style="font-
family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-size:12pt;">&#32;in Marketing. Tesoro remains 
confident in delivering these annual improvements to operating income. Through 
the first half of the year, estimated Refining improvements are trending towards
the high end of the range, Marketing improvements are on track with full year 
expectations and estimated Logistics improvements are tracking slightly below 
the range, primarily attributable to slower than expected organic growth due to 
the weak commodity price environment.</font></div><div style="line-
height:120%;text-align:justify;font-size:12pt;"><font style="font-
family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-size:12pt;"><br></font></div><div><br></div><div 
style="text-align:center;"><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:right;font-
size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">Tesoro 
Corporation 2016 </font><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-
size:10pt;font-weight:bold;">|</font><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-
serif;font-size:10pt;">&#32;</font><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-
serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:bold;">3</font></div></div><hr style="page-
break-after:always"><div></div><div><br></div><div style="line-height:120%;font-
size:12pt;"><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-
size:12pt;color:#828282;font-weight:bold;">PUBLIC INVITED TO LISTEN TO ANALYST 
AND INVESTOR CONFERENCE CALL</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-
align:justify;font-size:12pt;"><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-
size:12pt;">At 7:30 a.m. CT tomorrow morning, Tesoro will broadcast, live, its 
conference call with analysts regarding </font><font style="font-
family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-size:12pt;">second</font><font style="font-
family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-size:12pt;">&#32;quarter </font><font 
style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-size:12pt;">2016</font><font 
style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-size:12pt;">&#32;results and other 
business matters. Interested parties may listen to the live conference call over
the Internet by logging on to </font><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-
serif;font-size:12pt;color:#0000ff;text-
decoration:underline;">http://www.tsocorp.com</font><font style="font-
family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-size:12pt;">.</font></div><div style="line-
height:120%;text-align:justify;font-size:12pt;"><font style="font-
family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-size:12pt;"><br></font></div><div style="line-
height:120%;text-align:justify;font-size:12pt;"><font style="font-
family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-size:12pt;color:#828282;font-weight:bold;">ABOUT 
TESORO CORPORATION</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-
align:justify;font-size:12pt;"><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-
size:12pt;">Tesoro Corporation, a Fortune 100 company, is an independent refiner
and marketer of petroleum products. Tesoro, through its subsidiaries, operates 
</font><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-
size:12pt;">seven</font><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-
size:12pt;">&#32;refineries in the western United States with a combined 
capacity of over </font><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-
size:12pt;">895,000</font><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-
size:12pt;">&#32;barrels per day and ownership in a logistics business, which 
includes an interest in Tesoro Logistics LP (NYSE: TLLP) and ownership of its 
general partner. Tesoro's retail-marketing system includes over </font><font 
style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-size:12pt;">2,400</font><font 
style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-size:12pt;">&#32;retail stations 
under the ARCO</font><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-
size:12pt;"><sup style="vertical-align:top;line-height:120%;font-
size:pt">&#174;</sup></font><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-
size:12pt;">, Shell</font><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-
size:12pt;"><sup style="vertical-align:top;line-height:120%;font-
size:pt">&#174;</sup></font><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-
size:12pt;">, Exxon</font><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-
size:12pt;"><sup style="vertical-align:top;line-height:120%;font-
size:pt">&#174;</sup></font><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-
size:12pt;">, Mobil</font><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-
size:12pt;"><sup style="vertical-align:top;line-height:120%;font-
size:pt">&#174;</sup></font><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-
size:12pt;">, USA Gasoline&#8482;, Rebel&#8482; and Tesoro</font><font 
style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-size:12pt;"><sup style="vertical-
align:top;line-height:120%;font-size:pt">&#174;</sup></font><font style="font-
family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-size:12pt;">&#32;brands.</font></div><div 
style="line-height:120%;text-align:justify;font-size:12pt;"><font style="font-
family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-size:12pt;"><br></font></div><div style="line-
height:120%;text-align:justify;font-size:11pt;"><font style="font-
family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-style:italic;">This earnings 
release contains certain statements that are &#8220;forward-looking&#8221; 
statements within the meaning of Section 27A of the Securities Act of 1933 and 
Section 21E of the Securities Exchange Act of 1934 concerning the ability of our
integrated business model to continue performing well, even in a challenging 
refining margin environment; our ability to continue driving sustainable 
improvements to the business and grow Logistics and Marketing to further enhance
shareholder value; our positioning and ability to continue executing our 
financial priorities of investing in high-return capital projects, returning 
cash to shareholders, and maintaining a strong balance sheet; the ability of our
recently acquired wholesale marketing and logistics assets to enhance our 
capabilities to efficiently and reliability serve customers in the state of 
Alaska; our expectations to continue to market ultra-low sulfur diesel to local 
customers from our recently acquired refinery near Dickinson, North Dakota and 
utilize the naphtha and residuals in our integrated value chain system; our 
expectations regarding the sale of storage and terminalling assets in Alaska to 
TLLP, including the timing of closing for the second phase of the transaction; 
the impact of crude differentials on our capture rates, refining profitability 
and other factors on our expectations for 2016 and our revised expectations for 
year-over-year improvements from higher utilization and operational 
efficiencies; our ability to deliver anticipated annual improvements to 
operating income in 2016 and the impact of the weak commodity price environment 
on our targeted 2016 Logistics improvements; expectations for throughput, 
manufacturing costs, depreciation, corporate expense and interest expense in the
third quarter of 2016; and our outlook for 2016 capital 
expenditures.</font><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-
size:11pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">&#32;</font><font style="font-
family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-style:italic;">For more 
information concerning factors that could affect these statements see our annual
report on Form 10-K and quarterly reports on Form 10-Q, filed with the
Securities and Exchange Commission. We undertake no obligation to publicly 
release the result of any revisions to any such forward-looking statements that 
may be made to reflect events or circumstances that occur, or which we become 
aware of, after the date hereof.</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-
align:justify;font-size:12pt;"><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-
size:12pt;"><br></font></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-

size:12pt;">Tesoro Media Relations, media@tsocorp.com, (210) 626-
7702</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:justify;font-
size:12pt;"><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-
size:12pt;"><br></font></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-
align:justify;font-size:12pt;"><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-
size:12pt;"><br></font></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-
align:justify;font-size:12pt;"><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-
size:12pt;"><br></font></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-
align:justify;font-size:12pt;"><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-
size:12pt;"><br></font></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-
align:justify;font-size:12pt;"><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-
size:12pt;"><br></font></div><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-
family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt;"><tr><td 
style="width:36px;"></td><td></td></tr><tr><td style="vertical-align:top"><div 
style="line-height:120%;font-size:9pt;padding-left:12px;"><font style="font-
family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-size:9pt;">(a)</font></div></td><td 
style="vertical-align:top;"><div style="line-height:120%;text-
align:justify;font-size:9pt;"><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-
size:9pt;">After-tax amount utilizes the marginal tax 
rate.</font></div></td></tr></table><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" 
style="font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt;"><tr><td 
style="width:36px;"></td><td></td></tr><tr><td style="vertical-align:top"><div 
style="line-height:120%;font-size:9pt;padding-left:12px;"><font style="font-
family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-size:9pt;">(b)</font></div></td><td 
style="vertical-align:top;"><div style="line-height:120%;text-
align:justify;font-size:9pt;"><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-
size:9pt;">As a performance benchmark, we utilize crack spreads and the Tesoro 
Index to measure the difference between market prices for crude oil and refined 
products.&#160;Crack spreads are a commonly used proxy within the industry to 
estimate or identify trends in gross refining margins, while the Tesoro Index is
more specifically designed around Tesoro&#8217;s assets. Crack spreads and the 
Tesoro Index can fluctuate significantly over time as a result of market 
conditions and supply and demand balances. For example, The West Coast 321 crack
spread is calculated using three barrels of Alaska North Slope crude oil (ANS) 
producing two barrels of Los Angeles CARB gasoline and one barrel of Los Angeles
CARB diesel. In comparison the Tesoro Index uses several crude oils and 
approximately 8 to 10 products to provide a potentially closer representation of
the trends in the available margin. Our actual gross refining margins differ 
from these crack spreads and the Tesoro Index based on the actual slate of crude
oil we run at our refineries and the products we produce or 
yield.</font></div></td></tr></table><div><br></div><div style="text-
align:center;"><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:right;font-
size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">Tesoro 
Corporation 2016 </font><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-
size:10pt;font-weight:bold;">|</font><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-
serif;font-size:10pt;">&#32;</font><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-
serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:bold;">4</font></div></div><hr style="page-

v style="line-height:120%;text-align:justify;font-size:12pt;"><font style="font-
family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-size:12pt;color:#828282;font-weight:bold;">ITEMS 
IMPACTING COMPARABILITY</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-
align:justify;text-indent:24px;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-
family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;"><br></font></div><div style="line-
height:120%;text-align:justify;text-indent:24px;font-size:10pt;"><font 
style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">The TLLP financial and 
operational
 data presented include the historical results of all assets acquired from 
Tesoro prior to the acquisition dates. The acquisitions from Tesoro were 
transfers between entities under common control. Accordingly, the financial 
information of TLLP contained herein has been retrospectively adjusted to 
include the historical results of the assets acquired in the acquisitions from 
Tesoro prior to the effective date of each acquisition for all periods 
presented. The TLLP financial data is derived from the combined financial 
results of the TLLP predecessor (the &#8220;TLLP Predecessor&#8221;). We refer 
to the TLLP Predecessor and, prior to each acquisition date, the acquisitions 
from Tesoro collectively, as &#8220;TLLP&#8217;s 
Predecessors.&#8221;</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-
align:justify;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-
size:10pt;"><br></font></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-
align:justify;font-size:12pt;"><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-
size:12pt;color:#828282;font-weight:bold;">NON-GAAP MEASURES</font></div><div 
style="line-height:120%;text-align:justify;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-
family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;"><br></font></div><div style="line-
height:120%;text-align:justify;text-indent:24px;font-size:10pt;"><font 
style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">Our management uses 
certain performance &#8220;non-GAAP&#8221; measures to analyze operating segment
performance. Our management also uses additional measures that are known as 
&#8220;non-GAAP&#8221; financial measures in its evaluation of past performance 
and prospects for the future to supplement our financial information presented 
in accordance with accounting principles generally accepted in the United States
of America (&#8220;U.S. GAAP&#8221;). These financial non-GAAP measures are 
important factors in assessing our operating results and profitability and 
include the following:</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-
align:justify;text-indent:24px;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-
family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;"><br></font></div><table 
cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="padding-bottom:4px;font-family:Times New 
Roman; font-size:10pt;"><tr><td style="width:60px;"></td><td></td></tr><tr><td 
style="vertical-align:top"><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:10pt;padding-
left:36px;"><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-
size:10pt;">&#8226;</font></div></td><td style="vertical-align:top;"><div 
style="line-height:120%;text-align:justify;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-
family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">U.S. GAAP-based net earnings before 
interest, income taxes, and depreciation and amortization expense 
(&#8220;EBITDA&#8221;); </font></div></td></tr></table><table cellpadding="0" 
cellspacing="0" style="padding-bottom:4px;font-family:Times New Roman; font-
size:10pt;"><tr><td style="width:60px;"></td><td></td></tr><tr><td 
style="vertical-align:top"><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:10pt;padding-
left:36px;"><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-
size:10pt;">&#8226;</font></div></td><td style="vertical-align:top;"><div 
style="line-height:120%;text-align:justify;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-
family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">Segment EBITDA is defined as a 
segment&#8217;s U.S. GAAP operating income before depreciation and amortization 
expense plus equity in earnings (loss) of equity method investments and other 
income (expense), net; and</font></div></td></tr></table><table cellpadding="0" 
cellspacing="0" style="padding-bottom:4px;font-family:Times New Roman; font-
size:10pt;"><tr><td style="width:60px;"></td><td></td></tr><tr><td 
style="vertical-align:top"><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:10pt;padding-
left:36px;"><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-
size:10pt;">&#8226;</font></div></td><td style="vertical-align:top;"><div 
style="line-height:120%;text-align:justify;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-
family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">Debt to capitalization ratio 
excluding TLLP, reflects the ratio achieved by dividing the net result of our 
consolidated debt less all debt owed by TLLP (both net of unamortized issuance 
costs) by the sum of our consolidated debt less TLLP&#8217;s total debt (both 
net of unamortized issuance costs) and our total equity less noncontrolling 
interest associated with the public ownership of 
TLLP.</font></div></td></tr></table><div style="line-height:120%;text-
align:justify;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-
size:10pt;"><br></font></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-
align:justify;text-indent:24px;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-
family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">We present the measures defined above
because investors, analysts, lenders and ratings agencies may use these measures
to help analyze our results of operations and liquidity in conjunction with our 
U.S. GAAP results, including but not limited to the following:</font></div><div 
style="line-height:120%;text-align:justify;text-indent:24px;font-
size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-
size:10pt;"><br></font></div><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" 
style="padding-bottom:4px;font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt;"><tr><td 
style="width:60px;"></td><td></td></tr><tr><td style="vertical-align:top"><div 
style="line-height:120%;font-size:10pt;padding-left:36px;"><font style="font-
family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">&#8226;</font></div></td><td 
style="vertical-align:top;"><div style="line-height:120%;text-
align:justify;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-
size:10pt;">our operating performance as compared to other publicly traded 
companies in the refining, logistics and marketing industries, without regard to
historical cost basis or financing methods;</font></div></td></tr></table><table
cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="padding-bottom:4px;font-family:Times New 
Roman; font-size:10pt;"><tr><td style="width:60px;"></td><td></td></tr><tr><td 
style="vertical-align:top"><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:10pt;padding-

style="line-height:120%;text-align:justify;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-
family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">our ability to incur and service debt
and fund capital expenditures;&#160;and</font></div></td></tr></table><table 
cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-family:Times New Roman; font-
size:10pt;"><tr><td style="width:60px;"></td><td></td></tr><tr><td 
style="vertical-align:top"><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:10pt;padding-
left:36px;"><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-

style="line-height:120%;text-align:justify;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-
family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">the viability of acquisitions and 
other capital expenditure projects and the returns on investment of various 
investment opportunities.</font></div></td></tr></table><div style="line-
height:120%;text-align:justify;text-indent:24px;font-size:10pt;"><font 
style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;"><br></font></div><div 
style="line-height:120%;text-align:justify;text-indent:24px;font-
size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">In 
addition, these measures are used by management to assess internal performance. 
We believe these measures, when supplemental to information presented under U.S.
GAAP, may provide meaningful information to the users of our financial 
statements. Each of the performance measures should not be used in isolation 
from their comparable U.S. GAAP measure and thus should not be considered as 
alternatives to any U.S. GAAP measure. Non-GAAP measures have important 
limitations as analytical tools, because they exclude some, but not all, items 
that affect net earnings and operating income.</font></div><div style="line-
height:120%;text-align:justify;text-indent:24px;font-size:10pt;"><font 
style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-
size:10pt;"><br></font></div><div><br></div><div style="text-align:center;"><div

million</font><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-
size:9pt;">&#32;at </font><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-

serif;font-size:9pt;">December&#160;31, 2015</font><font style="font-
family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-size:9pt;">, respectively, for our crude oil, 
refined products, oxygenates and by-product inventories to adjust carrying value
of our inventories to reflect replacement cost as of those reporting dates. We 
reverse any lower of cost or market reserve in the subsequent period because the
inventories are sold or used and then perform a complete lower of cost or market
assessment of ending inventories at the end of each reporting period to 
determine if a reserve is required.</font></div></td></tr></table><div

style="font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt;"><tr><td 
style="width:48px;"></td><td></td></tr><tr><td style="vertical-align:top"><div 
style="line-height:120%;font-size:9pt;padding-left:24px;"><font style="font-
family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-size:9pt;">(j)</font></div></td><td 
style="vertical-align:top;"><div style="line-height:120%;text-
align:justify;font-size:9pt;"><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-
size:9pt;">Sources of total refined product sales include refined products 
manufactured at our refineries and refined products purchased from third
parties.</font></div></td></tr></table><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" 
style="font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt;"><tr><td 
style="width:48px;"></td><td></td></tr><tr><td style="vertical-align:top"><div 
style="line-height:120%;font-size:9pt;padding-left:24px;"><font style="font-
family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-size:9pt;">(k)</font></div></td><td 
style="vertical-align:top;"><div style="line-height:120%;text-
align:justify;font-size:9pt;"><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-
size:9pt;">Refined product sales include intersegment sales to our marketing 
segment of </font><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-
size:9pt;">$3.8 billion</font><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-
size:9pt;">&#32;and </font><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-
size:9pt;">$4.8 billion</font><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-
size:9pt;">&#32;for the </font><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-
size:9pt;">three</font><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-
size:9pt;">&#32;months ended </font><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-
serif;font-size:9pt;">June&#160;30, 2016</font><font style="font-
family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-size:9pt;">&#32;and </font><font style="font-
family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-size:9pt;">2015</font><font style="font-
family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-size:9pt;">, respectively, and </font><font 
style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-size:9pt;">$6.8 billion</font><font 
style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-size:9pt;">&#32;and </font><font 
style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-size:9pt;">$8.5 billion</font><font 
style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-size:9pt;">&#32;for the </font><font 
style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-size:9pt;">six</font><font 
style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-size:9pt;">&#32;months ended 
</font><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-size:9pt;">June&#160;30,
2016</font><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-size:9pt;">&#32;and 
</font><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-
size:9pt;">2015</font><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-
size:9pt;">, respectively.</font></div></td></tr></table><div><br></div><div 
style="text-align:center;"><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:right;font-
size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">Tesoro 
Corporation 2016 </font><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-
size:10pt;font-weight:bold;">|</font><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-
serif;font-size:10pt;">&#32;</font><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-
serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:bold;">12</font></div></div><hr style="page-
break-after:always"><div></div><div><br></div><table cellpadding="0" 
cellspacing="0" style="font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt;"><tr><td 
style="width:48px;"></td><td></td></tr><tr><td style="vertical-align:top"><div 
style="line-height:120%;font-size:9pt;padding-left:24px;"><font style="font-
family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-size:9pt;">(l)</font></div></td><td 
style="vertical-align:top;"><div style="line-height:120%;text-
align:justify;font-size:9pt;"><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-
size:9pt;">Gross refining margin approximates total refining throughput 
multiplied by the gross refining margin per barrel. Consolidated gross refining 
margin combines gross refining margin for each of our regions adjusted for other
amounts not directly attributable to a specific region. Gross refining margin 
includes the effect of intersegment sales to the marketing segment and services 
provided by TLLP. Gross refining margin reflects the incremental expense or 
benefit associated with the LCM adjustments for all periods 
presented.</font></div></td></tr></table><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" 
style="font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt;"><tr><td 
style="width:48px;"></td><td></td></tr><tr><td style="vertical-align:top"><div 
style="line-height:120%;font-size:9pt;padding-left:24px;"><font style="font-
family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-size:9pt;">(m)</font></div></td><td 
style="vertical-align:top;"><div style="line-height:120%;text-
align:justify;font-size:9pt;"><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-
size:9pt;">Management uses various measures to evaluate performance and 
efficiency and to compare profitability to other companies in the industry, 
including gross refining margin per barrel, manufacturing costs before 
depreciation and amortization expense (&#8220;Manufacturing Costs&#8221;) per 
barrel. We calculate gross refining margin per barrel by dividing gross refining
margin (revenues for manufactured refined products sold less costs of 
feedstocks, purchased refined products, transportation and distribution) by
total refining throughput. We calculate Manufacturing Costs per barrel by 
dividing Manufacturing Costs by total refining 
throughput.</font></div></td></tr></table><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0"
style="font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt;"><tr><td 
style="width:48px;"></td><td></td></tr><tr><td style="vertical-align:top"><div 
style="line-height:120%;font-size:9pt;padding-left:24px;"><font style="font-
family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-size:9pt;">(n)</font></div></td><td 
style="vertical-align:top;"><div style="line-height:120%;text-
align:justify;font-size:9pt;"><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-
size:9pt;">Gross refining margin per throughput barrel on a consolidated and 
regional basis includes the incremental expense or benefit associated
 with the LCM adjustments for all periods 
presented.</font></div></td></tr></table><div style="line-height:120%;text-
align:justify;font-size:9pt;"><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-
size:9pt;"><br></font></div><div><a

by </font><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-
size:9pt;">$0.05</font><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-

operational data.</font></div></td></tr></table><div><br></div><div style="text-

size:9pt;">,
 respectively. Operating expenses also include imbalance gains and 
reimbursements pursuant to the Amended Omnibus Agreement of </font><font 
style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-size:9pt;">$5 million</font><font 
style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-size:9pt;">&#32;and </font><font 
style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-size:9pt;">$11 million</font><font 
style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-size:9pt;">&#32;for the </font><font 
style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-size:9pt;">three</font><font 
style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-size:9pt;">&#32;months ended 
</font><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-size:9pt;">June&#160;30,
2016</font><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-size:9pt;">&#32;and 
</font><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-
size:9pt;">2015</font><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-
size:9pt;">, respectively, and </font><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-
serif;font-size:9pt;">$12 million</font><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-
serif;font-size:9pt;">&#32;and </font><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-
serif;font-size:9pt;">$19 million</font><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-
serif;font-size:9pt;">&#32;for the  </font><font style="font-
family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-size:9pt;">six</font><font style="font-
family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-size:9pt;">&#32;months ended </font><font 
style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-size:9pt;">June&#160;30, 
2016</font><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-size:9pt;">&#32;and 
</font><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-
size:9pt;">2015</font><font style="font-family:Calibri,sans-serif;font-
size:9pt;">, respectively. These amounts are eliminated upon consolidation. TLLP
segment third-party operating expenses related to the transportation of crude 
oil and refined products related to Tesoro&#8217;s sale of those refined 
products during the ordinary course of business are reclassified to cost of 
sales in our condensed statements of consolidated operations upon consolidation.
</font></div></td></tr></table><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" 
style="font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt;"><tr><td

calculate it in different ways. We calculate fuel margin per gallon by dividing 
fuel gross margin by fuel sales volumes. Fuel margin and fuel margin per gallon
